data.description: This playbook gathers all of the events associated with the Risk Notable and imports them as artifacts. It also generates a custom markdown formatted note.

advanced.description: Reaches back into splunk to search for any hits where the detected URL was accessed by users

artifact_create.description: Create a new artifact with the specified attributes.

fields.description: Container which the artifact will be added to.
fields.label: container
fields.name: container

fields.description: The name of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "artifact".
fields.label: name
fields.name: name

fields.description: The label of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "events"
fields.label: label
fields.name: label

fields.description: The severity of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "Medium". Typically this is either "High", "Medium", or "Low".
fields.label: severity
fields.name: severity

fields.description: The name of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as "destinationAddress" or "sourceDnsDomain". Required only if cef_value is provided.
fields.label: cef_field
fields.name: cef_field

fields.description: The value of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as the IP address, domain name, or file hash. Required only if cef_field is provided.
fields.label: cef_value
fields.name: cef_value

fields.description: The CEF data type of the data in cef_value. For example, this could be "ip", "hash", or "domain". Optional.
fields.label: cef_data_type
fields.name: cef_data_type

fields.description: A comma-separated list of tags to apply to the created artifact, which is optional.
fields.label: tags
fields.name: tags

fields.description: Either "true" or "false", depending on whether or not the new artifact should trigger the execution of any playbooks that are set to active on the label of the container the artifact will be added to. Optional and defaults to "false".
fields.label: run_automation
fields.name: run_automation

fields.description: Optional parameter to modify any extra attributes of the artifact. Input_json will be merged with other inputs. In the event of a conflict, input_json will take precedence.
fields.label: input_json
fields.name: input_json

artifact_create.label: artifact_create
artifact_create.name: artifact_create

data.template: No results seen for URL {0} when searching  zscaler or gateway data in the last 24 hours.

(index=msexchange sourcetype="MSExchange:*:MessageTracking" sender="{0}") OR
(index=o365 sourcetype=ms:o365:reporting:messagetrace SenderAddress="{0}") OR
(index=mcafee sourcetype=mcafee:smtp Event="*Email Status*" From="*{0}*")
earliest=-24h@h AND latest=now
| rex field=_raw "^[^\<]+\<(?<message_id_header>[^\>]+)\>"
| rex field=_raw ",\s+to=(?<mcafee_rcpt>.*),\s+virtual_host="
| rex mode=sed field=mcafee_rcpt "s/(\<|\>)//g"
| eval mcafee_rcpt=split(mcafee_rcpt, ", ")
| eval mcafee_subj=if(match(sourcetype, "mcafee:smtp"), subject, null())
| rex mode=sed field=mcafee_subj "s/(^\'|\'$)//g"
| eval mcafee_sender=if(match(sourcetype, "mcafee:smtp"), From, null())
| rex mode=sed field=mcafee_sender "s/(^\<|\>$)//g"
| rex field=_raw ",\s+attachment\(s\)=\'(?<attachments>[^\']+)\'"
| eval attachments=split(attachments, ", ")
| rex field=_raw "number-attachment\(s\)=\'(?<mcafee_num_attachments>[0-9]+)\'"
| eval sender=lower(coalesce(SenderAddress, sender, mcafee_sender))
| eval recipient=lower(coalesce(RecipientAddress, recipient, mcafee_rcpt))
| eval subject=coalesce(mcafee_subj, Subject, subject)
| eval event_id=upper(coalesce(Status, event_id, if(match(sourcetype, "mcafee:smtp"), "RELAY", null())))
| eval num_attachments=coalesce(AttachCount, mcafee_num_attachments)
| eval message_id=coalesce(MessageTraceId, message_id, msgid)
| rename OriginalFromAddress AS envelope_from
| eval indexSourcetype=index + " [" + sourcetype + "]"
| search index=*
| table _time host sender envelope_from recipient subject num_attachments attachments event_id indexSourcetype message_id message_id_header source_id inbox_autoforwarding | search 
| mvexpand recipient
| search NOT recipient=*@parlaph.mail.onmicrosoft.com
| eval event_id=coalesce(source_id.":".event_id, event_id)
| fillnull value=""
| stats earliest(_time) as e, latest(_time) as l, values(event_id) as events, values(attachments) as attachments count by sender recipient subject message_id_header
| sort e
| eval firstevent=strftime(e, "%d-%m-%y %H:%M:%S"), lastevent=strftime(l, "%d-%m-%y %H:%M:%S"), events=mvjoin(events, ", ")
| table firstevent, lastevent, sender, recipient, subject, attachments, events

Results found for sender {0}

Link to Dashboard
No results seen when searching for sender {0}

asset_get_attributes.description: Allows the retrieval of an attribute from an asset configuration for access in a playbook. This can be valuable in instances such as a dynamic note that references the Asset hostname. Must provide asset name or id.

fields.description: Asset numeric ID or asset name.
fields.label: asset
fields.name: asset

asset_get_attributes.label: asset_get_attributes
asset_get_attributes.name: asset_get_attributes

advanced.description: Formats a query to reach back into the risk index to pull out all the detections that led up to the notable triggering. The time tokens contain the earliest and latest times found in info_min_time and info_max_time
advanced.note: Formats a query to reach back into the risk index to pull out all the detections that led up to the notable triggering. The time tokens contain the earliest and latest times found in info_min_time and info_max_time

data.template:
(index=zscaler sourcetype=zscalernss-web url IN({0}))
OR 
(index IN (gateway, mcafee) sourcetype=mcafee:wg:kv url IN({0}))
earliest="-30d" latest="now" 
| eval destip=coalesce(serverip, destip)
| eval srcip=if(match(sourcetype, "zscalernss-web"), if(isnull(clientpublicIP) OR match(ClientIP, clientpublicIP), ClientIP, ClientIP + " [NAT=" + clientpublicIP + "]"), srcip)
| eval user=if(match(index, "gateway") AND match(user, "unknown"), mvindex(split(host, "."), 0), user)
| eval content_type=coalesce(mt, contenttype)
| eval http_method=coalesce(requestmethod, http_method, mtd)
| eval user_agent=coalesce(http_user_agent, useragent, ua)
| eval bytes_to_server=coalesce(bytes_to_server, requestsize, mvindex(split(bytes, "/"), 0))
| eval bytes_to_client=coalesce(bytes_to_client, responsesize, mvindex(split(bytes, "/"), 3))
| eval block_id=if(match(status, "/"), mvindex(split(status, "/"), -1), null())
| eval status=if(match(status, "/"), mvindex(split(status, "/"), 0), status)
| eval action=coalesce(lower(action), action_fm_block_id)
| eval domain=coalesce(dhost, hostname)
| eval referrer=coalesce(refererURL, referer)
| table _time user srcip destip threatname domain url referrer http_method content_type status action user_agent bytes_to_server bytes_to_client sourcetype source
